medical_history.chief_complaint: Orthostatic syncope and body weight loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at age 27 and have progressively worsened over time, leading to muscle weakness, abnormal sensations in both legs, hyporeflexia in all four limbs, and autonomic failure including impotence, urinary and fecal incontinence, and lower limb edema.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient underwent orthotopic live-donor liver transplantation at age 31 to alleviate and prevent exacerbation of neuronal and cardiac symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: Mother, mother's father, and mother's paternal aunt had similar symptoms.
